class_f_07_dragon_01: Hello, class! It is I, Hassel, yet again.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_02: My, my, how time flies, as they say![VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_03:
Indeed, our time together has certainly flown by.
It’s hard to believe that this is our last class.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_04:
Now, our topics for today may feel somewhat
unrelated to art.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_05:
But there is absolutely no set definition as to
what art should be![VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_06:
Therefore, let us carry on with the discussion and
see where it takes us![VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_07:
There are two things I wish to focus on today—
Ribbons...and marks![VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_08:
Both Ribbons and marks are special honors that
capture a Pokémon’s qualities.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_09:
There will be times when your Pokémon gives
maximum effort or has a noteworthy experience.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_10:
In recognition of its feats and accomplishments,
it can be given a Ribbon.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_11:
To give an example, if you manage to become
incredibly close to a Pokémon, it may be granted\r
the Best Friends Ribbon.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_12:
Incidentally, there is a person in Cascarrafa who
can give your Pokémon a Best Friends Ribbon.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_13:
Marks, on the other hand, are mostly found on
wild Pokémon when you meet them for the\r
first time.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_14:
They can symbolize the character of a Pokémon,
such as with the Rowdy Mark or the Vigor Mark.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_15:
It’s completely up to luck whether you’ll run into
a Pokémon with these marks![VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_16:
So if you’re able to catch a Pokémon with a
mark, rejoice at your outstanding fortune![VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_17:
Does anyone know what special thing you can do
with Pokémon that have Ribbons or marks?[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_answer_01:
Ah, unfortunately, you can’t transfer Ribbons or
marks from one Pokémon to another, nor can you\r
trade them with other people’s Pokémon.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_answer_02:
Well, yes, indeed you can show them off, but
surely that’s not the extent of your interest, is it?[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_answer_03:
[VAR BD06(0000)]Wonderful, [VAR TRNAME(0000)]! Your
knowledge\r
is\r
impressive.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_18:
The correct answer is that Pokémon with Ribbons
or marks can be given titles.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_19:
What’s more, they can be sent into battle
displaying a title of your choosing![VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_20:
For example, you could send out a Gible with
a Best Friends Ribbon by declaring...\r
“Go! Gible the Great Friend!”[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_21:
And while I know I just said that marks are
generally found already on Pokémon when you\r
meet them for the first time...[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_22:
it seems that more recently, Pokémon can be
awarded certain marks based on their efforts.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_23:
These are marks such as the Gourmand Mark,
the Itemfinder Mark, the Partner Mark, and so on.[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_24:
Perhaps it might be fun to try to work out how to
get each mark using its name as a clue?[VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_25: Well, that just about wraps up our last class![VAR 0114(0012)]
class_f_07_dragon_26:
Next is the final exam. Please review our material
closely so that you pass on your first try![VAR 0114(0012)]
